content.key_points:
- Unusual occurrence in the infant
- Salty skin: cystic fibrosis
- Apathy: cretinism
- Bleeding after circumcision: hemophilia
- Bleeding after tooth extraction: Von Willebrand’s disease
- Apnea of more than 20 seconds: apnea of infancy
- Early pattern of hand dominance (before 10-12 months): cerebral palsy
- Currant-jelly stool (Mucoid with blood): intussusception
- Jaundice in the first 24 hours after delivery: pathologic jaundice

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements made by a mother regarding her baby needs to be reported to the physician? Select all that apply:
options: 4. “Sometimes my baby doesn’t breathe for as long as 20 seconds.”
5. “I discovered at 7 months that my child is left-handed.”
6. “My baby’s stool is mucoid and bloody.”
7. “I don’t know whether my baby will ever grow his teeth, at 5 months he has none yet.”
questions.rationale:
**RATIONALE**

The statements indicate the presence of abnormalities in infants.

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete concept content on a single book page.
extraction_metadata.reference: Pillitteri, Adele. Maternal and Child Health Nursing, Philadelphia. Lippincott Williams and Wilkins
